text: We have identity management in a couple levels. Marketplace shows an example of participant permissioning like asset creation rules.  The consensus layer has a couple permissioning levels in progress for validators.  One is essentially public/open the other which is in progress a validator has to satisfy some condition like exhibiting a credential.
Where is Sawtooth code maintained as well as project documentation, issues, PRs, etc.?

attachments.title: hyperledger/sawtooth-core
attachments.text: sawtooth-core - Core repository for Sawtooth Lake Distributed ledger

text: <http://intelledger.github.io> here are the docs or you can build them from within the sawtooth-core/docs directory.
<@U268EB76W> in the community section of the docs there is information about PRs and issues.
<@U1L6PRGTF> and this slack channel is for all things sawtooth? No other channels of importance? I just need to monitor this one channel to stay in the loop, right?
Yes. This is the only sawtooth-lake specific channel.
